article.title: Positive scalar curvature and connected sums

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Definition 0.1 in the paper define?
What is the significance of Equation (1.2) in the proof?
choices: It defines the deformed Dirac operator.
It ensures the index of the Dirac operator is non-zero.
It establishes the relationship between scalar curvature and the Dirac operator.
It defines the cut-off function used in the proof.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main technique used in the proof of Theorem 0.2?
What does Equation (1.13) represent in the context of the proof?
choices: A contradiction derived from assuming positive scalar curvature.
The Lichnerowicz formula applied to the deformed Dirac operator.
The definition of the connected sum of two manifolds.
The definition of the Hermitian vector bundle used in the proof.
